intro: Obione philippii, commonly known as the Philippi's obione, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Obione philippii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
